title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.48 | 28-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The Supreme Lord Personality of God, it is one without a second.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami introduces verse SB 1.13.48, explaining that Narada Muni is addressing Yudhishthira Maharaj and emphasizing the Supreme Lord is one without a second, illustrating this point with the story of Paundraka who falsely claimed to be God.

segments.key_quote: The living beings are also manifestations of his marginal energy.
segments.summary: The lecture explains how the Lord manifests through different energies, including the marginal energy (living beings), highlighting the spiritual nature of living beings and how it is qualitatively one with the Lord, but pervertedly manifested in the material world due to contamination.

segments.key_quote: The perception of such ephemeral happiness and distress is due only to the forgetfulness of its qualities.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how material contamination leads to a false sense of identity and the experience of illusory happiness and distress, emphasizing that this is due to forgetfulness of our true spiritual qualities.

segments.key_quote: By his order only, one should become a spiritual master.
segments.summary: The lecture explains how the Lord makes arrangements to rectify the fallen condition of living beings, both internally as Paramatma and externally through the spiritual master and scriptures, emphasizing the importance of cooperating with the Lord's outward activities.

themes: qualities of a bonafide spiritual master
segments.key_quote: Nobody can be a spiritual master without the order from the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that a spiritual master must be authorized by the Lord and should not seek personal gain, highlighting the qualities of a bonafide spiritual master who is qualitatively one with the Lord, contrasting this with those who are forgetful of the Lord and perverted reflections.

segments.key_quote: But to look only unto the Lord to execute the mission for which the Lord has descended.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by reiterating Narada's instruction to Yudhishthira Maharaj to remain detached from happiness and distress and focus on executing the mission for which the Lord has descended.
